info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 17 at 6:23AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...An intense lake effect snow band will affect northern Portage... Trumbull...southeastern Geauga...northeastern Summit...southeastern Ashtabula and southwestern Crawford Counties Until 730 AM EST.... At 621 AM EST, radar indicated an intense lake effect snow band along a line extending from near Warrensville Heights to near Burton to near Meadville, moving southeast at 20 mph. A quick dusting of snow on area roadways may make them extremely slick during the early morning commute. HAZARDS INCLUDE... Visibility rapidly dropping to less than a quarter of a mile... Locations impacted include... Warren, Meadville, Ravenna, Solon, Hudson, Niles, Twinsburg, Streetsboro, Macedonia, Hubbard, Cortland, Newton Falls, Lordstown, Garrettsville, Kinsman, North Bloomfield, Mantua, West Farmington, Vienna Center and Adamsville. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this lake effect snow band. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until this snow band passes your location. && ODOT DMS 325 and 620.
